description:
You have reached the finals of a problem solving tournament, in the last challenge you are given two  arrays a and b both of size n and you can choose any element of array b and swap it with some other element of array b but only once. You are allowed to swap that element with itself effectively making the array b unchanged.

Your task is to minimize the sum of |ai-bi| for all i from 0 to n-1.
```
Sample Input - 1:

5
5 4 3 2 1
1 2 3 4 5

Sample Output - 1

4
```

Explanation: In order to minimize the sum we can swap the first and fifth element which make the array b as [5 2 3 4 1]
and sum = (5-5) + (4 -2) + (3-3) + (2-4) + (1-1) = 4 which is the minimum possible.

```
Sample Input - 2

5
4 2 8 1 6
9 7 3 2 4

Sample Output - 2

10
```
Explanation: You can swap the element at index 0 (9) with the one at index 2 (3). The total sum comes out to be 10 which is the minimum possible.

```
Constraints:

1<=n<=10^5
1<=a[i],b[i]<=10^8
```
title: The swap to minimize
